alert.note: Alert for Madison; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 7:50AM CDT until May 16 at 8:43PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Madison and Walker Counties. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bedias Creek near Madisonville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 19.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.5 feet on 01/15/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Bedias Creek Madisonvill 19.0 18.4 Mon 5 am CDT 18.8 17.8 16.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
